p:
Vibrio cholerae and phage strains were of environmental or clinical origin and were isolated during different seasonal epidemics of cholera in Bangladesh
1, 3, 25, 26 . These phages were initially selected from numerous isolates based on a preliminary analysis of their DNA restriction patterns and host range
1, 25 , and hence represented distinct groups. Phages were isolated from surface water samples in Dhaka city or stools collected anonymously from cholera victims reporting to the hospitals of the International Centre for Diarrhoeal Disease Research, Bangladesh (icddr,b). One or more of the indicator strains including G-3669 (El Tor), P-27457 (El Tor), AI 1852 (O139), and MO1220 (O139) were used as host bacteria for purification and amplification of different phages for the present study. Phages were stored in SM buffer (100 mM NaCl, 8.1 mM MgSO4, 0.05 mM Tris-Cl [pH 7.5], 0.01% gelatin) at 4 °C.
